Job Title: Sr Project Manager

Location: Missouri, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $35 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving sophisticated analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our distributed team of more than 130,000 colleagues delivers an outstanding combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands.

Senior Project Manager, Site Consultancy Services Specialist, North America

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment, or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you will be supported in achieving your career goals!

As the world leader in serving science, we empower our people to advance innovative technologies, develop meaningful solutions, and build exciting careers. With revenues of $43 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our 70,000 outstanding minds the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.

The Senior Project Manager Site Consultancy Services Specialist for the Materials and Structural Analysis Division (MSD) of Thermo Fisher Scientific is responsible to work closely with the Field Service Operations team and customer with the goal of delivering the Site Preparation Packages Consultancy Services.

This role is essential in developing relationships with key third party suppliers to support future growth of the SCS business. This includes familiarity with building trades such as HVAC, MEP along with reviewing construction drawings to and providing needed feedback the ThermoFisher Scientific customers. The purpose is to help the customers achieve site success, by ensuring the site is ready for the system install and free from environmental disturbances.

What will you do?

Lead the North America Site Preparation Consultancy Projects ensuring all the requirements are met and customer signoff is obtainedChampion positive relationships with customers by providing excellent customer service.Engage closely with the Subject Matter Experts, Field Service Engineers, and Field Service Managers to ensure customer all the information they need to achieve site readiness success.Works towards growing Site Consultancy as a businessSupport Field Service teams as the primary point of contact the customers’ site related questions and concerns.Coordinate interdepartmental resources ensuring completion of the program, regional alignment, and implementation.Applying PPI Business system, A3 Thinking, 5 Whys and GEMBA to support the regional field service organization.Up to 50% travel required

Minimum Qualifications:

This position is ideal for an experienced engineer/project manager looking for an opportunity to be part of a dynamic & complementary team in an environment where they will apply their skills to a variety of customer applications, system issues as well as site challenges.

A Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical or Electrical engineering, or equivalent combined with experience solving complex system issues and installing high-end, capital equipment which are highly impacted by environmental factors.Experience with multidisciplinary and multicultural project management.3 or more years demonstrated ability performing customer site evaluations for high end, capital equipment.Tried experience in solving complicated site & system issues. This will include identifying problem frequencies, locating the sources and providing mitigation techniques or options.Strong technical report writing skills.A validated understanding of Vibration, Acoustics, EMI, and other environmental factors.'A solid understanding of the most common sources of environmental factors and be able to make mitigation recommendations.Experience with AutoCAD is a plusRequires good judgement and lateral thinking to develop solutions to problems.Strong ability to effectively and professionally communicate at all levels with both internal and external customersGood skills in persuading, inspiring, developing, and motivating are required.Must have ability to acquire a valid passport and travel regionally and internationally as required.Must possess a valid driver’s license.

Benefits:

We offer driven remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus scheme, healthcare, company pension, and a range of employee benefits! Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation.

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one distributed team of 100,000 colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

EEO/Reasonable Accommodation:

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Experience Level (if available): None
